name: sync::rcu::non_null::either::<impl sync::rcu::non_null::NonNullPtr for util::either::Either<L, R>>::into_raw

sync::rcu::non_null::NonNullPtr::into_ra.doc:
Converts to a raw pointer.

 Each call to `into_raw` must be paired with a call to `from_raw`
 in order to avoid memory leakage.

 The lower [`Self::ALIGN_BITS`] of the raw pointer is guaranteed to
 be zero. In other words, the pointer is guaranteed to be aligned to
 `1 << Self::ALIGN_BITS`.

core::ptr::NonNull::<T>::map_addr.doc:
Creates a new pointer by mapping `self`'s address to a new one, preserving the
 [provenance][crate::ptr#provenance] of `self`.

 For more details, see the equivalent method on a raw pointer, [`pointer::map_addr`].

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.
